page.title: 10PASTIMES/WATER
page.content: PASTIMES Popular hobbies in the village are: horse riding,gardening, knitting, weaving and riding BMX pedal bicycles. WATER In a drought the water could come from Barcombe which together with Weir Wood is the main source.8000 cubic metres of water are used per day. (1 cubic metre of water is 220 gallons). The water costs Â£1.25 per 1000 gallons Aluminium sulphate, Chlorine, Sulphur Dioxide and tostic soda are used to clean the water.The chemicals cost Â£11000 per month and the machinery Â£25000. The water is pumped to us via Wych Cross and Uckfield. The only large river in the area is the Ouse.
